intro: Adenostemma nitidum, commonly known as the smooth adenostemma, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows as an erect, herbaceous perennial. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silky hair. Its showy, tubular flowers are usually pink or red, arranged in whorled clusters at the ends of the stems. Adenostemma nitidum is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and waste areas.
